wordpressPost.title: A Prime Lens and a Durga Pujo To Test It Out!
wordpressPost.content:
There wasn’t too much ofÂ pandal hopping this year. There were a couple ofÂ adda sessions with my friends, and I went out with my parents and Gunja to visit a few pandals around Kolkata. My birthday coincided withÂ Saptami.Â It turned out to be really nice.

My mother had a 37mm f2.8 prime lens that she used with her SLR camera.

She gave it to me a few months back, but I couldn’t use it since it wouldn’t fit on my camera. My parents gifted me an adapter ring on my birthday.

ThisÂ blog post has 28 random photos that I took with the prime lens, around pandals in Kolkata and at my house.

It’s tougher to focus than my other two Canon lenses. I have to zoom in every time and check the image to be absolutely sure. However, it does not reduce image quality ðŸ™‚ And additionally, I can get a larger amount of bokeh.
